hosp_near_10_median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest hospitals. Facility location data were collected from the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services repository. Drive times were computer using Open Source Routing Machine (looking at roads for 2021). Geographies: Block group (12), Census tract (11), County (5)
hosp_near_10_median.long_name: Hospital availability by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes

sources.name: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services

hosp_near_10_median.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest hospitals to {features.name} is {value}.

hosp_3sfca.long_description: Hospital access score is based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined as the demand for facilities (in the adult population). Geographies: Block group (12), Census tract (11), County (5)
hosp_3sfca.long_name: Hospital geographic availability (3-step floating catchment areas)

sources.name: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services

hosp_3sfca.statement: The hospital geographic availability score for {features.name} is {value}.

hosp_cnt.long_description: Count of hospitals based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services repository.Geographies: Block group (12), Census tract (11), County (5)

sources.name: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services

wan12.title: A three-step floating catchment area method for analyzing spatial access to health services
wan12.journal: International Journal of Geographical Information Science

bii21.title: catchment: Calculate spatial access and availability metrics
